00:00:36:020000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:00:36:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:36:020000.Dialogue: That's a Hanukkah present you're regretting, huh?

00:00:39:220000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:00:39:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:39:220000.Dialogue: I won't say that all senior citizens who can't master technology should be publicly flogged, but if we made an example of one or two, it might give the others incentive to try harder.

00:00:52:190000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:00:52:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:52:190000.Dialogue: I had a great idea. You know how we're always having to stop and solve differential equations, like when you're doing Fourier analysis, or using the Schrodinger equation?

00:01:01:160000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:01:01:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:01:160000.Dialogue: Howard doesn't. He's only an engineer.

00:01:05:070000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:01:05:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:05:070000.Dialogue: I was thinking, we could write a little app that would use handwriting recognition, and then run it through a symbolic evaluation engine. You just use your smartphone, take a picture of the equation and bam!

00:01:16:200000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:01:16:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:16:200000.Dialogue: You know what's a great app? The one that makes fart noises.

00:01:24:150000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:01:24:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:24:150000.Dialogue: You know, Leonard, that's actually a valid idea. Very good.

00:01:29:220000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:01:29:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:29:220000.Dialogue: Can you say that and not make it sound like I'm a cat who learned how to use the toilet?

00:01:36:040000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:01:36:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:36:040000.Dialogue: No. The two achievements are equally surprising and equally admirable, though if pressed, I'd have to give a slight edge to the cat. I'll save you the pain and nervousness of waiting for the answer. I agree to be part of your project. Congratulations.

00:01:52:130000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:01:52:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:52:130000.Dialogue: Oh, yay for me. What about you guys? I can't promise anything, but people do make money off stuff like this.

00:02:00:170000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:02:00:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:00:170000.Dialogue: A few extra bucks would be nice. I could finally move out of my mother's house.

00:02:04:020000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:02:04:020000.Speaker: Raj

00:02:05:080000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:02:05:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:05:080000.Dialogue: I always dreamed about building a little place of my own over the garage.

00:02:09:190000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:02:09:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:09:190000.Dialogue: You know, if I made more money, I could take time off from work and give pretty girls submarine rides.

00:02:15:060000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:02:15:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:15:060000.Dialogue: What's that? Some weird sex thing?

00:02:18:200000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:02:18:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:18:200000.Dialogue: No. You take pretty girls underwater in your private submarine, and you show them fish. Why does everything have to be dirty with you?

00:02:27:230000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:02:27:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:27:230000.Dialogue: I was thinking we could work on this at night, and then maybe in a couple of weeks, we'll have ourselves an app to sell.

00:02:34:010000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:02:34:010000.Speaker: Howard

00:02:35:070000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:02:35:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:35:070000.Dialogue: I think we should take a picture to capture this moment.

00:02:37:220000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:02:37:220000.Speaker: Leonard

00:02:43:230000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Howard is on the phone.
00:02:43:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:43:230000.Dialogue: Was that the best 99 cents I ever spent, or what?

00:03:14:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:14:120000.Dialogue: I checked the App Store. No one is doing handwriting-recognition differential equation solving.

00:03:23:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:23:180000.Dialogue: You have so few good ideas, Leonard. And you're just going to spill the beans in front of an outsider?

00:03:37:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:37:210000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I don't think Penny cares about handwriting-recognition based differential...

00:03:59:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:59:070000.Dialogue: Whatever your secret is, I'm sure it's boring, so I'm not interested.

00:04:02:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:02:170000.Dialogue: It's not boring at all. You see, in higher order mathematics, there are certain sets of equations that...

00:04:10:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:10:230000.Dialogue: Hardly. Consider this unlikely but very plausible scenario. A young woman alone in the big city. Her ridiculous dream of becoming an actress lies shattered about her.

00:04:23:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:23:120000.Dialogue: Well, hang on. Let's see where he's going.

00:04:25:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:25:110000.Dialogue: Then it hits her. How is she going to survive? I mean, she has no prospects, no marketable skills. And then one day, she meets a group of geniuses and their friend Howard.

00:04:41:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:41:140000.Dialogue: Hang on. Let's see where he's going.

00:04:45:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:45:030000.Dialogue: She befriends them, and then lies in wait until they reveal a marketable idea, which she steals and sells to the highest bidder.

00:05:03:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:03:130000.Dialogue: Oh, great. You know what? I've already mooched dinner off you guys. I don't need to listen to this.

00:05:11:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:11:090000.Dialogue: All right, I've taken the liberty of drafting these workflow charts which outline our various duties and the path we will follow as we develop our ground-breaking new app.

00:05:21:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:21:130000.Dialogue: Hey, why am I in charge of phone support?

00:05:28:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:28:140000.Dialogue: A customer service representative with an Indian accent will create the impression we're a vast enterprise that uses overseas call centers.

00:05:35:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:35:120000.Dialogue: Oh. Very clever. But still racist.

00:05:44:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:44:140000.Dialogue: Why am I listed as your executive assistant?

00:05:48:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:48:050000.Dialogue: Because the word "secretary" has fallen into disrepute. FYI, my mother's birthday is coming up. I'm going to need you to pick up a present.

00:05:57:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:57:190000.Dialogue: Okay, we need to stop for a minute.

00:06:00:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:00:020000.Dialogue: Leonard, please, we can talk during our break. We have one coming up at midnight. We'll need snacks.

00:06:05:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:05:070000.Dialogue: Sheldon, you're not in charge. It's my idea. I'm in charge.

00:06:08:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:08:110000.Dialogue: Oh, of course you are. Look at the organizational chart. You're clearly listed as founder.

00:06:12:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:12:130000.Dialogue: Well, yes, and you're listed as Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer and Chief Operating Officer.

00:06:19:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:19:110000.Dialogue: You missed Chief Science Officer, Chairman of the Board, and Head of the Secret Santa Committee.

00:06:23:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:23:230000.Dialogue: Okay. You need to get clear on this right now. I am in charge of this project.

00:06:30:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:30:200000.Dialogue: Ooh. Leonard's going all alpha nerd on Sheldon's ass...

00:06:36:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:36:110000.Dialogue: All right. All right, I'm not going to argue with you. Sheldon Cooper is nothing if not a team player. Dr. Hofstadter, you have the conn.

00:06:45:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:45:120000.Dialogue: Thank you. I thought we might start by talking about the user interface.

00:06:54:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:54:050000.Dialogue: So this button here will allow you to scan a new equation, but over here, you can press this, and just substitute new values for the coefficients.

00:07:09:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:09:100000.Dialogue: This diagram. I assume you were opening with a joke. It certainly buoyed up this employee's esprit de corps.

00:07:18:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:18:090000.Dialogue: It's not a joke. It's the real design.

00:07:20:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:20:140000.Dialogue: In that case, may I offer 27 little tweaks to make it slightly less embarrassing?

00:07:25:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:25:220000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I think this will work. Let's just try it my way.

00:07:29:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:29:140000.Dialogue: Oh, I'm-I'm sorry. I assumed that you wanted candid truth-telling from your employees, but I realize now, you want the mindless nattering of complacent yes-men.

00:07:44:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:44:200000.Dialogue: So right now, this button-press event is just triggering a dummy procedure call...

00:07:48:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:48:170000.Dialogue: How about this for the app name? The Surprisingly Helpful Equation-Linked Differential Optimized Numerator.

00:08:04:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:04:190000.Dialogue: We're not doing names now. Howard?

00:08:08:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:08:130000.Dialogue: Like I was saying, right now it's just a dummy procedure, but eventually, it will drop us into...

00:08:11:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:11:210000.Dialogue: SHELDON: All right, fine. If we're not going to give it a name, can we at least give it a secret code designation?

00:08:33:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:33:200000.Dialogue: We're not wasting time with names right now.

00:08:37:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:37:140000.Dialogue: I see. Is that decision open for discussion?

00:08:42:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:42:100000.Dialogue: Is the decision to not discuss it open for discussion?

00:08:46:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:46:100000.Dialogue: HOWARD: Again, right now it's just a dummy procedure, but eventually, it will drop us into...

00:08:52:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:52:060000.Dialogue: I call for a vote of no confidence and an immediate change in leadership.

00:08:56:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:56:170000.Dialogue: When in the course of human events, it becomes necessary to dissolve the bonds that tie three competent scientists together...

00:09:16:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:16:060000.Dialogue: Because you're impossible to work with.

00:09:19:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:19:130000.Dialogue: I see. And is that open for discussion?

00:09:38:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:38:030000.Dialogue: I think you'll be pleased with what the elves were up to last night.

00:09:43:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:43:030000.Dialogue: Oh, I know. I'm now an independent contractor.

00:09:45:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:45:090000.Dialogue: No, you are now nothing. You have no connection to this project whatsoever.

00:09:54:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:54:040000.Dialogue: I don't want it better. I want it my way.

00:09:56:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:56:100000.Dialogue: Well, that speaks volumes, doesn't it? All right, I suppose I'll go put on my bus pants.

00:10:03:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:03:180000.Dialogue: What the hell are bus pants?

00:10:06:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:06:000000.Dialogue: They are pants one wears over one's regular pants when one sits on bus seats that other people have previously sat on.

00:10:13:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:13:230000.Dialogue: But perhaps from your lofty heights atop the corporate ladder, you've lost touch with the struggles of the common man.

00:10:20:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:20:190000.Dialogue: Look, I'm still happy to drive you to work. Nothing's changed in that regard. We're still roommates, we're still friends.

00:10:28:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:28:110000.Dialogue: Except you identified me, your best friend, as a gangrenous limb that needed to be severed from the organism and tossed away. The desperate act of a little man with a big Napoleon complex.

00:10:41:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:41:060000.Dialogue: You know what? Go put on your bus pants.

00:10:51:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:51:050000.Dialogue: Mm. Last night, I had a dream we got so rich from the app, you and I bought matching side-by-side mansions. But... there was a secret tunnel connecting your front yard to my back yard.

00:11:08:080000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:08:080000.Dialogue: What do you think that means?

00:11:11:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:11:070000.Dialogue: It means after we play handball, I'm showering at home.

00:11:18:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:18:030000.Dialogue: Good morning, Friend Howard. Friend Raj. I see you gentlemen are enjoying beverages. Perhaps they would taste better out of these.

00:11:30:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:30:200000.Dialogue: Don't thank me. You earned it.

00:11:41:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:41:220000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. I typed that into the label maker, but I just couldn't press enter. Now down to business. What would it take for you to abandon Leonard and join me in a rival company? Unless, of course, the mugs are sufficient, in which case, welcome aboard.

00:11:59:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:59:210000.Dialogue: I understand. Your loyalty is admirable. But what if I were to up the ante?

00:12:08:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:08:120000.Dialogue: Monogrammed key chains with a built-in laser pointer.

00:12:19:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:19:150000.Dialogue: How about can cozies emblazoned with our university mascot? Go, Beavers.

00:12:33:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:33:050000.Dialogue: Okay, let's try this one. Spherical Hankel function.

00:12:43:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:43:220000.Dialogue: Hey, we agreed when it was "Eureka" time, we were all gonna say it together.

00:12:51:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:51:230000.Dialogue: Greetings, gentlemen. How goes your little project?

00:12:59:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:59:230000.Dialogue: Ah, a combination of all your names. Very clever. I assume "Koothranardowitz" was taken?

00:13:08:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:08:170000.Dialogue: We're actually scanning equations and getting good results.

00:13:11:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:11:200000.Dialogue: Oh, well then, by all means, carry on. I wouldn't want to impede your progress.

00:13:16:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:16:020000.Dialogue: Howard, did you solve the install time problem yet?

00:13:18:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:18:140000.Dialogue: No. It's a little tricky. I'm gonna try having it pick up the libraries dyn...

00:13:36:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:36:070000.Dialogue: No. I mean, what are you doing with a theremin?

00:13:39:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:39:130000.Dialogue: Playing it. I've loved the theremin from the first moment I heard the original Star Trek theme. And it's been killing me that it just sits in my closet, gathering dust.

00:14:08:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:08:040000.Dialogue: That's all right. I can barely hear you over my theremin.

00:14:18:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:18:200000.Dialogue: Well, that was a little uncalled for.

00:14:21:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:21:150000.Dialogue: No, that was completely called for. We need quiet.

00:14:24:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:24:220000.Dialogue: So, your project is more important than mine?

00:14:27:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:27:070000.Dialogue: Well, seeing as your project is to sabotage my project, yes.

00:14:31:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:31:130000.Dialogue: Don't beat around the bush, Leonard. If you don't want me here, just say the word, and I'll leave.

00:14:40:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:40:220000.Dialogue: Could have beaten around the bush a little.

00:15:01:200000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:15:01:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:01:200000.Dialogue: What you doing? Trying to contact your home planet?

00:15:05:190000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:15:05:190000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:08:090000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:15:08:090000.Speaker: Penny

00:15:21:150000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:15:21:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:21:150000.Dialogue: Something got you down, there, Sheldon?

00:15:23:190000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:15:23:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:23:190000.Dialogue: Leonard kicked me out of my own apartment. And his app team.

00:15:27:110000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:15:27:110000.Speaker: Penny

00:15:29:150000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:15:29:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:29:150000.Dialogue: He wouldn't drive me to work today. I had to wear my bus pants.

00:15:33:160000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:15:33:160000.Speaker: Penny

00:15:36:230000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:15:36:230000.Speaker: Penny

00:15:38:040000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:15:38:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:38:040000.Dialogue: Probably going to have to throw them away.

00:15:42:090000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:15:42:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:42:090000.Dialogue: Hey, you don't need Leonard and his app. You can make one with me.

00:15:46:020000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:15:46:020000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:49:100000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:15:49:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:49:100000.Dialogue: Seriously, I have a great idea for one.

00:15:51:220000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:15:51:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:51:220000.Dialogue: Is it better than your idea to move to Los Angeles and become a famous actress?

00:15:58:160000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:15:58:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:58:160000.Dialogue: Okay, look... when you see someone wearing shoes you like, you just snap a picture of them, and the app goes on the Internet to find out where you can buy them.

00:16:05:150000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:16:05:150000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:07:230000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:16:07:230000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:08:210000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:16:08:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:08:210000.Dialogue: I didn't say that. But no, I don't.

00:16:10:230000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:16:10:230000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:13:120000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:16:13:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:13:120000.Dialogue: Oh, Penny, where do I begin? The simple-mindedness of your idea is exceeded only by its crass consumerism and banality.

00:16:21:020000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:16:21:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:21:020000.Dialogue: And Leonard didn't want to work with you? Imagine that.

00:16:24:150000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:16:24:150000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:34:100000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:16:34:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:34:100000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I'm gonna make some cocoa.

00:16:36:120000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:16:36:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:36:120000.Dialogue: Do you want some? Do you make it with milk or water?

00:16:39:210000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:16:39:210000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:41:130000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:16:41:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:41:130000.Dialogue: That's what it says on the packet.

00:16:43:150000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:16:43:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:43:150000.Dialogue: Do you have those little marshmallows?

00:16:45:190000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:16:45:190000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:46:190000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:16:46:190000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:49:050000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:16:49:050000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:50:080000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is playing his theramin.
00:16:50:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:50:080000.Dialogue: A disappointing drink for a disappointing day.

00:16:56:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:56:230000.Dialogue: Hey, look at this. 20 people from the university have already signed up for our private beta.

00:17:01:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:01:180000.Dialogue: I'm telling you, the Lenwoloppali Differential Equation Scanner meets a real need. We've got a hit.

00:17:07:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:07:230000.Dialogue: What do you think we should sell it for?

00:17:09:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:09:100000.Dialogue: Well, based on the fact that our potential market is about 70 or 80 guys, and you want a submarine, I'd say about a million dollars a pop.

00:17:17:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:17:010000.Dialogue: Well, what if we put out a lite version for half a million? You know, get the word of mouth going.

00:17:23:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:23:060000.Dialogue: Hi. I'm sorry to bother you guys, but you've got to come take your Sheldon back.

00:17:27:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:27:040000.Dialogue: What's he doing in your apartment?

00:17:28:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:28:230000.Dialogue: Well, he was moping down in the lobby, so I invited him over. Now I regret it.

00:17:32:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:32:160000.Dialogue: Why do you regret... Uh, never mind, stupid question.

00:17:35:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:35:070000.Dialogue: Look, can't you just let him play with you until bedtime?

00:17:37:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:37:160000.Dialogue: We're not playing. This is real work.

00:17:44:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:44:220000.Dialogue: Okay. What if I got him to apologize and promise to behave?

00:17:51:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:51:110000.Dialogue: Then I guess we would let him back on the app team, and while we're doing that, you could take an aerial tour of L.A. on your flying pig.

00:18:03:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:03:030000.Dialogue: I'll tell you one thing. If I get rich enough, that's the kind of girl I want to take on a submarine ride.

00:18:09:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:09:170000.Dialogue: And yes, that time, I meant it to be dirty.

00:18:18:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:18:060000.Dialogue: Oh, yes. He says they are lost without you.

00:18:21:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:21:090000.Dialogue: Well, we sure saw that coming.

00:18:26:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:26:120000.Dialogue: You know what I'm going to do? I am going to sit here and just let them stew.

00:18:35:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:35:060000.Dialogue: No, no, no. You know, they have suffered enough. Everybody's suffered enough. The thing is, you're going to have to offer him a face-saving way out of this.

00:18:47:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:47:220000.Dialogue: Oh, no. Mrs. Mary Cooper didn't raise her no liars.

00:18:53:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:53:020000.Dialogue: Okay. Um... How about this? You know how you're always trying to learn about sarcasm?

00:19:03:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:03:170000.Dialogue: Oh. Good for you. So all you have to do here is say you're sorry to Leonard, but say it sarcastically.

00:19:10:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:10:020000.Dialogue: Of course. He will hear it as an attempt to mend fences, as opposed to the withering condemnation you and I will know it to be.

00:19:19:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:19:090000.Dialogue: Yeah. Yeah, that was my plan. All right. Come on. Let's go.

00:19:23:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:23:030000.Dialogue: Oh, by the way, thank you for the delicious cocoa.

00:19:27:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:27:130000.Dialogue: Boy, I'm getting good at this.

00:19:32:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:32:150000.Dialogue: Okay, now that you're back on the team, let's get you caught up.

00:19:36:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:36:000000.Dialogue: Before you begin, let me say again how deeply sorry I am for my earlier behavior and how much I respect and admire your leadership.

00:19:53:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:53:180000.Dialogue: So as you can see, not only can you store your favorite equations, but you can forward them to your friends or post them on Facebook right from the app.

00:20:03:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:03:110000.Dialogue: Well, I must say, I am impressed.

00:20:06:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:06:140000.Dialogue: You all have clearly put in a lot of hard work.

00:20:10:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:10:000000.Dialogue: As a result, you have taken the most important step on the road to success: learning what not to do. Now, let's start fresh. Howard, we're going to need some tea.
